intro: Hieracium hymenopterum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium hymenopterum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
